1) Die.

Day 1-whatever: Kill all 12,510 people in my town.

Day whatever-end of apocalypse: Face trial for the murder of over 12,000 people.

1. Never believe in zombies

2. Worry about the economy, the state of the world, or other tangible and more prominent and important things instead of zombies

3. Put enough canned goods & possibly bottled or canned water away to survive a tornado or other natural disaster comfortably (too inland to get hurricanes, earthquakes will almost certainly never happen where I live in my lifetime)

4. Work at a good job and save enough money to retire comfortably and without worry

Hour 25 (DMSP time): Refuel the Soyuz. Then refuel the other Soyuz.

Hour 27-82: Plan.

Hour 88: Un-dock Zvezda from the ISS. Dock Soyuz I to the adapter. Dock the Adapter to Zvezda. Dock back to the ISS.

Hour 89-92: EVA, scrap all equipment and get the metal for survival.

Hour 93: Un-dock Soyuz II from the ISS (You are piloting it). Dock Soyuz II to the Adapter, and balance the weight using Progress I.

Hour 94: Un-dock Soyuz I from Zvezda. Board the ISS and un-dock Zvezda from the station. Then, Get Progress II and dock it to the second last available docking port.

Hour 95: Pack all you need, get ready, take a deep breath, and look back at Earth. Say goodbye.

Hour 96: Un-dock Soyuz I from the ISS. Dock to the final docking adapter.

Ta-da! You now have a Inter-Planetary Vehicle.

Hour 97: Do a burn to Mars.

Day 371, Hour 1: Retro Burn at Mars. Dump the Progresses, because their fuel is dry.

Hour 1.2: EVA and modify the chutes so Soyuz I has the chutes from Soyuz II and from the New Emergency After-Suit Chutes*.

Hour 2: Un-dock Soyuz I and latch it on to the front port.

Hour 4: Retro Burn. Use Zvezda as a heat-shield.

Hour 5: Wish for good luck.

Hour 5.3: Dump Burned up Zvezda. Watch it fall, and say thank-you.

Hour 5.39: Un-dock the adapter, and watch the Adapter and Soyuz II fall away. Say thanks again.

Hour 5.43: Start Slowing down. Dump the Soyuz orbital module, and fire the rockets. Use RCS as well.

Hour 5.46: Deploy the chutes 2 by 2, and dump the service module.

Hour 5.5: Land, using the safe little Landing SRBs. Step out on the surface, and trudge to Mars One's colony.

Hour 6: Relax, and cry for all those you lost.

You did it! You survived!

*Emergency After-Suit Chutes might actually exist. If you were able to survive a re-entry but your capsule was damaged, you would bail out and use a After-Suit Chute to land safely.
